title: Stir-fried beef and asparagus
ingredients: Bunch of good fresh and green asparagus
cornflour mixed to a paste with water
method: Thinly slice steak across the grain in pieces small enough to handle with chopsticks.
Mix about 1 level teaspoon each of crushed garlic and ginger and sesame oil, and a heaped teaspoon of cornflour to the meat and let it sit while you prepare the asparagus.
Wash asparagus and break off hard ends.
Slice the rest of it in about 1cm thick diagonal slices about 5cm long.
Heat a tablespoon of peanut oil to smoking hot in a wok, then add the meat, let it sear before starting to turn it.
Do not overcook; you need to have some pink still in the meat before tossing in the asparagus.
Stir a couple of minutes to cook the asparagus.
Pour about 1/2 cup water in the wok to deglaze it, then thicken with cornflour paste to make a light gravy.
Season with salt and oyster sauce.
Serve on steamed rice topped with sliced shallots.
